Class IplText

A simple text class to hold information on operations performed on images, last updated 10/11/1999. More...

Data Structures

struct  TIplText
 Contains a list of strings used to insert lines with information about operations performed. More...

Detailed Description

A simple text class to hold information on operations performed on images, last updated 10/11/1999.

The structures TImage, TIntImage, TComplexImage and TFloatImage all have an attribute of this type to store information about which methods have been used on the image. It is possible to search this history list for previous calls by the methods Find() and FindNext(). Items cannot be removed, but a call to Empty() will remove all items leaving only one line containing information on how many lines (calls to methods) were deleted. All strings appended to the list will be appended with a date and time stamp. These stamps can be turned off by setting the members AppendTime and AppendDate in TIplText to false. All lines inserted will also be appended a '#' character at the front and a '
' at the end. Methods can only insert single lines, that is lines without the '
' character.

These functions are part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

Version:
0.4, by edr@mip.sdu.dk
Author:
René Dencker Eriksen

int    argc,
const char **    ppArgv
) 
 

Appends a command promt argument list to the text list.

@pText The list of text to append the command prompt string to.

Parameters:

ppArgv  List of arguments from command prompt.
Returns :
false if argv is a NULL pointer.

bool k_AppendText (  TIplText *    pText,
const char *    pStr
) 
 

Appends a new string to the text list.

Date is added in the front if the AppendDate is set to true in the TIplText structure. Time is added after date is AppendTime is true in TIplText.

Parameters:
Text  The list of text to append the new string to.
pStr  The string to be appended.
Returns :
false if line contains the character '
'.

const TIplText *    pSource
) 
 

Copies whole TIplText structure from "pSource" to "pDest".

Previous data in "pDest" are destroyed unless the function returns false, in that case pDest is unchanged.

Returns :
False, if source and destination text is the same.

bool k_FindNextText (  TIplText *    pText,
TString *    pResult
) 
 

Finds the next entry in the list containing the text given by a previous call to Find().

Only one occurence in each line is found, i.e. a line can only be returned in pResult one time.

Parameters:
pResult  The found string, unchanged if not found.
Returns :
False if not found.

Definition at line 271 of file kernel_text.c.

References TIplText::FindPosition, k_AddFileAndLine, k_CopyString(), k_EmptyString(), k_FindInString(), k_InitString(), k_ShowMessage(), TString::NumberOfChars, TIplText::NumberOfLines, TString::pChars, TIplText::pStringList, and TIplText::SearchStr.

bool k_FindText (  TIplText *    pText,
const char *    pStr,
TString *    pResult
) 
 

Finds first entry in the list containing the text given in pStr, the whole line is returned in pResult.

The search string is copied to the SearchStr member of pText to be used by the function k_FindNextText().

Parameters:
pStr  The text to search for.
pResult  The found string, unchanged if not found.
Returns :
False if not found.

void k_InitText (  TIplText *    pText ) 
 

Initializes the TIplText structure.

AppendTime and AppendDate are set to true. FindPosition is set to 0. SearchStr is set to NULL. StringList is initialized to a NULL pointer. FileInfo is initialized with k_InitFileInfo.

Parameters:
pText  Structure to initialize

bool k_LoadText (  TIplText *    pText,
const char *    pFileName
) 
 

Loads history file.

Must be the same format as normal representation, old history is deleted before loading.

Parameters:
pFileName  Name of file including extension and relative or absolute path, f.ex. absolut path "c:/temp/history.txt", relative "history.txt". Both slash ("/") and back slash ("\") can be used in the path. There is no differense between upper and lower case characters, they are treated equally.
Returns :
false if load failed, in this case the pText will be empty.

Definition at line 356 of file kernel_text.c.

References TIplText::AllocatedLines, k_AddCharArrayToString(), k_AddFileAndLine, k_EmptyString(), k_InitString(), k_ShowMessage(), TIplText::NumberOfLines, and TIplText::pStringList.

bool k_RemoveLastLineText (  TIplText *    pText ) 
 

Removes last line from the history, for internal use only.

Returns :
False, if the history is empty (ie. could not remove line).

Definition at line 576 of file kernel_text.c.

References TIplText::NumberOfLines.

Referenced by kC_Save(), kF_Save(), and kI_Save().

bool k_SaveText (  TIplText *    pText,
const char *    pFileName
) 
 

Saves the history list to a file.

The history list is always saved inside a PGM file.

Parameters:
pFileName  Name of file including extension and relative or absolute path, f.ex. absolut path "c:/temp/history.txt", relative "history.txt". If no string is given, the file will be saved with the filename set in the member variable m_FileInfo. If this class is an object in the CStdImage class, the m_FileInfo will be set to the same value as the CStdImage fileinfo (contained in the m_Image member), except that the file extension is "txt". Both slash ("/") and back slash ("\") can be used in the path. There is no differense between upper and lower case characters, they are treated equally.
Returns :
false, if both pFileName and the m_FileInfo are NULL.

Definition at line 402 of file kernel_text.c.

bool k_SetFileInfoFromPathFileText (  TIplText *    pText,
const char *    pPathAndFileName
) 
 

Sets the file information for the TIplText structure from a given path and file name.

The extension from the original path and filename is replaced with "txt".
